intro: Dionysia kossinskyi, commonly known as the Kossinsky's dionysia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showing adaptations to the harsh maritime climate. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
